paragraphs.text:
%md
# About
**Lab:** Hive Partitions
**Objective:** Become familiar with using Hive partitions
**File locations:** /tmp/data/
**Successful outcome:** Understanding hive partitions
**Before you begin:** N/A
**Related lessons:** Data Engineering with Hive 

---

%md
# Setup

paragraphs.title: Required for Kerberos operations
paragraphs.text:
%sh

echo $PASS | kinit $USER

paragraphs.title: Retrieve the files from IMDb
paragraphs.text:
%sh
rm -r tmp
mkdir -p tmp
cd tmp
wget -nv https://datasets.imdbws.com/title.basics.tsv.gz
wget -nv https://datasets.imdbws.com/title.crew.tsv.gz
wget -nv https://datasets.imdbws.com/name.basics.tsv.gz
wget -nv https://datasets.imdbws.com/title.ratings.tsv.gz
gunzip title.basics.tsv.gz
gunzip title.crew.tsv.gz
gunzip name.basics.tsv.gz
gunzip title.ratings.tsv.gz
ls -l

paragraphs.title: Clean Database and HDFS Folders
Copy the data in HDFS
paragraphs.text:
%sh

hdfs dfs -rm -r /tmp/raw
hdfs dfs -mkdir -p /tmp/raw
hdfs dfs -put -f tmp/title.basics.tsv /tmp/raw/
hdfs dfs -put -f tmp/title.crew.tsv /tmp/raw/
hdfs dfs -put -f tmp/name.basics.tsv /tmp/raw/
hdfs dfs -put -f tmp/title.ratings.tsv /tmp/raw/
hdfs dfs -chmod -R 777 /tmp/raw/
hdfs dfs -mkdir -p /tmp/movies
hdfs dfs -chmod -R 777 /tmp/movies

paragraphs.title: Create the movies database
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)

-- Contains the following information for titles
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE movie_title (
                        tconst string,
                        titleType string,
                        primaryTitle string,
                        originalTitle string,
                        isAdult string,
                        startYear string,
                        endYear string,
                        runtimeMinutes string,
                        genres ARRAY<STRING>
                        ) ROW FORMAT DELIMITED
FIELDS TERMINATED BY '\t' 
LOCATION '/tmp/movies/movie_title/'
TBLPROPERTIES ('external.table.purge'='true');

-- Load data
LOAD DATA  INPATH '/tmp/raw/title.basics.tsv' OVERWRITE INTO TABLE movie_title;

-- Remove header for movie_title
ALTER TABLE movie_title SET TBLPROPERTIES ("skip.header.line.count"="1");


-- Contains the information for directors and writers
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE movie_crew(
                        tconst string,
                        directors ARRAY<STRING>,
                        writers ARRAY<STRING>
                        ) ROW FORMAT DELIMITED
FIELDS TERMINATED BY '\t'
LOCATION '/tmp/movies/movie_crew/'
TBLPROPERTIES ('external.table.purge'='true');

-- Load data movie_crew
LOAD DATA  INPATH '/tmp/raw/title.crew.tsv' OVERWRITE INTO TABLE movie_crew;

-- Remove header for movie_crew
ALTER TABLE movie_crew SET TBLPROPERTIES ("skip.header.line.count"="1");

-- Contains the information for names
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE movie_crew_info(
                        nconst string,
                        primaryName string,
                        birthYear string,
                        deathYear string,
                        primaryProfession ARRAY<STRING>,
                        knownForTitles ARRAY<STRING>
                        ) ROW FORMAT DELIMITED
FIELDS TERMINATED BY '\t' 
LOCATION '/tmp/movies/movie_crew_info/'
TBLPROPERTIES ('external.table.purge'='true');

-- Load data movie_crew_info
LOAD DATA  INPATH '/tmp/raw/name.basics.tsv' OVERWRITE INTO TABLE movie_crew_info;

-- Remove header for movie_crew_info
ALTER TABLE movie_crew_info SET TBLPROPERTIES ("skip.header.line.count"="1");


-- Ratings and vote information for titles
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE ratings(
                        tconst string,
                        averageRting double,
                        numVotes int
                        ) ROW FORMAT DELIMITED
FIELDS TERMINATED BY '\t' 
LOCATION '/tmp/movies/ratings/'
TBLPROPERTIES ('external.table.purge'='true');


-- Load data ratings
LOAD DATA  INPATH '/tmp/raw/title.ratings.tsv' OVERWRITE INTO TABLE ratings;

-- Remove header for ratings
ALTER TABLE ratings SET TBLPROPERTIES ("skip.header.line.count"="1");

%md
# Lab

paragraphs.text:
%md
In the next cell execute the following command:
```console
EXPLAIN EXTENDED Select count(*) from movie_title where startYear='1999';
```

paragraphs.title: 3 - Execute Explain Plan

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%md
We are going to create a table that is partitioned using dynamic partitioning

~~~
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE  movie_title_partition( 
                        tconst string,
                        titleType string,
                        primaryTitle string,
                        originalTitle string,
                        isAdult string,
                        endYear string,
                        runtimeMinutes string,
                        genres ARRAY<STRING>
                        ) 
PARTITIONED BY (startYear string)
ROW FORMAT DELIMITED
FIELDS TERMINATED BY '\t' 
LOCATION '/tmp/movies/movie_title_partition/'
TBLPROPERTIES ('external.table.purge'='true');

DESCRIBE FORMATTED movie_title_partition;

INSERT INTO TABLE movie_title_partition
PARTITION(startYear)
Select tconst,titleType,primaryTitle,originalTitle,isAdult,endYear,runtimeMinutes,genres,startYear
from movie_title;


~~~

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

paragraphs.title: 4 - Drop and Create the movie_title_partition table
5 - Load movie_title_partition using movie_title table
6 - Execute the same explain plan query on the new table

paragraphs.text:
%md
### What are some differences between the explain plans?

%md
### We are going to create another partitioned table...
Make a new external table from the movie_crew_info table and Partition the table  by birthYear

%md

```console
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
show partitions movie_crew_info_partition;
```

paragraphs.title: 10 - List the partitions for the partitioned table

paragraphs.text:
%md
#Practice SQL

paragraphs.title: 11 - Execute a query on the partitioned movie title table. Find the  title in uppercase of all the  movies that are Short genre and have a runtime over 60 minutes.
12 - Delete all of the movie titles that have a start year of 1959? ( What happens?) Try to solve. Hint: Hive ACID
13 -  What's the total runtime minutes of  short titles in 2001?

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Result
**You have now:** You have now successfully created a Hive partitioned table and ran queries on the tables.

%md

paragraphs.title: 4 - Drop and Create the movie_title_partition table
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)

drop table IF EXISTS movie_title_partition;
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE  movie_title_partition( 
                        tconst string,
                        titleType string,
                        primaryTitle string,
                        originalTitle string,
                        isAdult string,
                        endYear string,
                        runtimeMinutes string,
                        genres ARRAY<STRING>
                        ) 
PARTITIONED BY (startYear string)
ROW FORMAT DELIMITED
FIELDS TERMINATED BY '\t' 
LOCATION '/tmp/movies/movie_title_partition/'
TBLPROPERTIES ('external.table.purge'='true');

paragraphs.title: 7 - Drop and create the partitioned table
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)

DROP TABLE IF EXISTS movie_crew_info_partition;
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE movie_crew_info_partition( 
                        nconst string,
                        primaryName string,
                        deathYear string,
                        primaryProfession ARRAY<STRING>,
                        knownForTitles ARRAY<STRING>
                        ) 
PARTITIONED BY (birthYear string )
ROW FORMAT DELIMITED
FIELDS TERMINATED BY '\t' 
LOCATION '/tmp/movies/movie_crew_info_partition/'
TBLPROPERTIES ('external.table.purge'='true');

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 8 - Load the partitioned table
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)

INSERT INTO TABLE movie_crew_info_partition
PARTITION(birthYear)
SELECT nconst,primaryName,deathYear,primaryProfession,knownForTitles,birthyear
FROM movie_crew_info;

paragraphs.title: 11 - Execute a query on the partitioned movie title table. Find the  title of all the  movies that are non-adult, Short genre and have a runtime over 60 minutes.
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)

SELECT upper(primarytitle) FROM movie_title_partition WHERE runtimeminutes>60 AND array_contains(genres, 'Short')

paragraphs.title: 13 -  Whats the total runtime minutes of  short titles in 2001?
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)

SELECT sum(runtimeminutes) FROM movie_title_partition WHERE array_contains(genres, 'Short')

paragraphs.text:
%md

We hope you've enjoyed this lab. Below are additional resources that you should find useful:

1. [Cloudera Tutorials](http://cloudera.com/tutorials.html) are your natural next step where you can explore Spark in more depth.
2. [Cloudera Community](https://community.cloudera.com) is a great resource for questions and answers on Spark, Data Analytics/Science, and many more Big Data topics.
3. [Apache Spark Documentation](https://spark.apache.org/documentation.html) - official Spark documentation.
4. [Apache Zeppelin Project Home Page](https://zeppelin.apache.org) - official Zeppelin web site.
